result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew James Kaydo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew James Kaydo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew James Kaydo was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Matthew James Kaydo was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew James Kaydo

records.addlTxt: 1:41 PM Defendant Matthew James Kaydo in court, in custody.  Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri in court for Matthew James Kaydo.  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.   On state's motion, ct 2 is dismissed as well as the repeater enhancers on cts 1 and 3.  DE enters guilty to cts 1 and 3.  On each count, court orders 23 days jail with credit for 23 days time served; court enters judgment on the bond forfeiture and applies bond to any fees/costs; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. Appeal rights given.

Attorney Balistrieri requests to scheduled plea/sentencing for next week; ADA Tombasco has no objection. Judge Dougvillo will hear plea/sentencing on 10/31/22 at 1:30 pm in Room 100. Parties all notified by email.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture - Return to Sender Not Deliverable as Addressed Unable to Forward

**CONTINUED**
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Crystal K O.  No disruptive contact with the Bluebird Motel in Kenosha.

1:58 PM
Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:30 am. $1000 Cash Bond Set w/ continued conditions (see bond entry). ec
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
Bench Warrant sent to JS
Bench warrant #KSD22309405

2:06 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew James Kaydo not in court. Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri in court for Matthew James Kaydo. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Balistrieri does not have an explanation as to why the DE is not here, but requests any warrant be stayed until Monday for reasons set forth on the record. Based on the DE's non-appearance the Court forfeits bond and issues a bench warrant with $1000.00 cash bond. Court will remove trial date from the calendar.
Defense Motion in Limine
Motion for Trial Adjournment filed by ADA Tombasco
filed by ADA Tombasco

09:49 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Matthew James Kaydo, appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Balistrieri advises the Court that the matter is not resolved and is requesting this case be set for trial. Attorney Balistrieri verbally makes a speedy trial demand on the record. Court schedules case for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
